Description: Cardboard black box (with no lid) containing well over 100 very small charred fragments of papyri, with dust; box also contains one piece of tissue paper similar to the papers wrapped around the charred rolls in EA 76499. Also a slip of paper marked '6'. Traces of script are visible, apparently cursive Greek.
Curator's comments: Previously unregistered. Identified in 2009 in trays of miscellaneous material that had been moved into store room M4. Being studied by Kim Ryholt (Copenhagen).
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: carbonised, fragmented, fragile, dust Black ink: visible with infra-red Red ink: ? Mount Details: Box: without lid Box: purpose made with Plastazote padding Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: E
